pros: Small town, good people to work with  and for. Knowledgeable Administrators working to make health care better.
willing to grow facility for large rural area
cons: needs to grow to cover large rural area offer incentives to bring/keep employees in this area

job_title: Registered Nurse%2C BSN in Glendive, MT
pros: Fun coworker relationships and laid back atmosphere.
cons: Not a great place to learn or be cutting edge

review_title: Protect your license don’t work here
pros: Shifts are always available to pickup
cons: Always in constant fear of losing your listener due to shady and unethical business practices

review_title: New here. 2015-Husband of new hire this year
job_title: Spouse of An Employee in Glendive, MT
pros: Somebody at GMC must have been reading these comments and taken them seriously. I know these comments are a couple years old, but i have noticed that alot of the "cons" reported are much different now. Actually, the NEW CEO is a pretty nice guy. I spoke to him in the cafeteria just the other day. It seems like everyone like him. I have gotten to know the HR department and they were instrumental in our transfer from the midwest.  HR included my whole family in the interview process (part of it, of course) allowing us to make an informed decision.They know ME by name and i'm not even staff there. Sometimes, things do change.
cons:
The insurance is pretty expensive for family coverage. At first, I thought it was paid for by GMC. It said that on the Explanation of Benefits paper If I remember correctly. "Paid by employer". I even mentioned what a great plan that was. As it turns out, the employer pays the insurance company ("Paid by employer"),  from your wage... That's the same way every other company does it anyway.
   Housing( if not provided ) can be pretty expensive here in Glendive; because of the oil boom nearby. That was a surprise to us. Online housing listings are pretty out dated.

review_title: Corruption is rampant at all levels...
pros: Decent pay for the area. I enjoy serving the community.
cons: I've never worked at such a cut throat place. Employees aren't promoted based on merit, but loyalty. If you pass the "tests" then you're rewarded. If you stand up for what you believe is right, you are silenced. Benefits have been drastically cut and instead of admitting that they're making cost saving decisions, they try to make it sound as if they were making some kind of sacrifice to begin with, or staff was taking advantage. I had an issue where I was dealing with verbal abuse so I went to HR to file a complaint. Instead of sympathizong, they made excuses for the individual.

pros: Great work/life balance. Supportive team members and management. A defined career path. Competitive pay. I look forward to coming to work everyday. This job continues to challenge me and allow me to grow both personally and professionally.
cons: People not paying their bills who have satellite TV, iPads, Cellphones, and new cars but then claim they can't afford their bill. Some community members do not appreciate all the great services we offer and all the jobs that GMC provides. I recommend they move to somewhere like Crow Agency, maybe then they will realize how good they have it.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Glendive, MT
pros: Residents are nice, and getting breakfast before going home.
cons: Residents they get ones that need a lock down unit in ex-tended care. can't manage. High turn over with staff in general. Most of the long good employees have left for better paying jobs. HR doesn't have your back when in a hostile work environment. Even when it is documented, witnessed, an reported before I handed my 2 wks notice in after working for 6 yrs. I reported my reason for quitting Hostile Work Environment and they didn't do nothing. Left a good person go walking out the door.

review_title: This place is horrible to work for......
pros: Nice community with friendly good hearted people.
cons: This company is scarey to work for. Now they are talking about lay offs.So many doctors have left because they can not get along with the CEO. They sent demand bills out and if people could not pay their bill at once they were sent to collections. Now people go elsewhere for fear of being turned into collections. The CEO is very controlling and the VP's and board do what he wants out of fear. The facility has no patients so now the staff get layed off. Why not lay off the CEO and VP's. The place would run better without them. The facilities has had some good managers but over time they leave to just like the doctors. It is all about the money in this place. The company is in finacial trouble.

pros: Competitive pay and benefits. Nice facilities and updated equipment helps you do your job well. The employees are great to work with.
cons: HR staff is inexperienced to say the least and NOT an advocate for the employees. We need strong leadership and someone who is willing to stand up for the staffs rights and not just do what leadership wants.

pros: Great entry level job with a vast variety of setting, including hospice, outpatient, inpatient and acute care, extended care facilities, WIC consulting, and 3 other nursing homes consulting.
cons: Small, boring down with nothing to do, expensive cost of living due to the oil boom, food is expensive.

review_title: I'll be fired if they find out I posted
pros: Good co-workers who really care about providing quality patient care; I don't have far to commute.  Patients are generally appreciative for the care and realize we aren't the incompetent ones.
cons: Doctors who are incompetent and refuse to listen to patient/staff concerns; Upper management is totally out of touch with community's well-founded concerns about the quality of care.

review_title: I wish there was another option
pros: Easy commute; trying to help friends and neighbors get good health care; you learn which doctors are competent and safe to see
cons: Incompetent administration; retribution when obvious errors in judgement are pointed out; not given tools or information to the job correctly.

pros: The staff care tremendously about the patients.
cons: HR doesn't look out for employees. If you have questions or issues your on your own. HR retaliates when you complain.  Jobs aren't opened like policy dictates. Some are given preferential treatment.

pros: The residents were awesome and it was a honor to care for our Veterans.
cons: The administration and senior staff except for one person were horrible.

pros: None that I can think of
cons: They do not follow standard laws and protocols
